You are given a grid of size $n \times m$ where each cell is either black ("B") or white ("W").  Determine if the black cells form a convex shape. A shape is convex if you can walk from any black cell to any other black cell by only moving to adjacent cells (up, down, left, right) and changing direction at most once.

**Input:**

* The first line contains two integers, $n$ and $m$, the dimensions of the grid.
* The next $n$ lines each contain $m$ characters, "B" or "W", representing the grid.

**Output:**

* Print "YES" if the black cells form a convex shape, otherwise print "NO".

You are given a grid of squares. Some squares are black, and some are white.  Determine if you can travel from any black square to any other black square, only moving to adjacent squares (up, down, left, right), and changing direction at most once.
